title: Connection Failure: Unable to connect to the PVP.net server problem
body: I moved to a new place and since then LOL have not worked properly. Everytime I start up league and enter my password, the issue of "Connection Failure: Unable to connect to the PVP.net server" comes up. I've noticed on the top left corner of the league screen it said "League of Legends 6.15.16_07_21_02_05" but I think we have got to patch 6.16 already haven't we?

replies.body: After I installed the latest patches for windows last night i keep getting the conection error constantly I did every solution listed by rito and I've also did alot more suggested by other pages. I've reinstalled the updates for windows that I downloaded last night (btw i have windows10) I' ve even deleted the updates, I tried also reinstalling the game and nothing helps. I am felling kinda helpless right now so please if anyone knows anything about this help me.

Patch 6.16 didn't deploy until this morning, so you were on the right version. As of posting this, there's currently an ongoing login service issue for NA, but if you continue to have issues after the incident is resolved, I recommend working through our [Login Issues guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-Issues)

Let me know if you have any questions.

I encountered the same problem again. I tried couple of the solutions but it either cut off my internet or didn't work. The syncing window clock solution might be a bit odd since it did not sync but called an error instead (for both solution).

Making any changes in that guide shouldn't cause any issues with your connection. When you say your internet cut off do you mean you lost all internet access? Are you on a wireless connection or wired into a modem or router?

When I changed my dns, I lost my internet connection. I'm currently using both wired and wireless and they all result the same. My friend suggests that it's the internet config problem but I tried bunch of things but they dont work. The wired internet I'm using is connected to Cisco phone.

That is certainly an interesting network configuration. At this point, I recommend running a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs), then attaching them to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). Our tech team will be able to dive into those logs and find the core issue.

Let me know if you have any questions.
i sent a ticket 3 days ago but havent got any reply back. my ticket id is #22806841 in case you need it.
